titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. V:30. Sleepless Night— Note from P.U.S. Cabinet Meeting at 11. Calhoun and Wirt— Cuba— Sanchez— Duponceau to Mason— Second Letter. Two Letters from Mason to him— Copies to be left— P.U.S. went for Albemarle. Letter to Lloyd— Dr Thornton here this Eve— Danish Slave.

2. VI: Deo gratias— Sleep— H. Johnson with Plauche and two other Louisianians— Dr Thornton— At Anderson’s Office— Rector’s Letter— Told him of Anderson at Tripoli. Storm— First fire, Chess. Stone at the Office, with fac simile’s

3. VI— Winter Cloathing— Office room repairs— Pen-ring. J. Mitchell at the Office— Visit to the Louisianians— Letters to C. A. Rodney. T. D. Arnold. A. Gallatin and Charles— Chess— Diary 5–7 [symbols][August]. Dr. Thornton to borrow.

4. VI— Note from C. J. Burckle— His visit— Loan for Colombia. His Powers— B Elbers— Santander. About Mexico and San Martin. At the Office. L. Chasstant and L. D. Shewell— Letters to P.U.S. and A. Dickins— Evening at T. Cook’s— Chess.

5. V:15. D. Brent here, recovered— J. Law died last Night. G. . Erving here from Monticello and Montpelier. Dr Tucker and Berald, from Cambridge Law Lectures— H. Johnson— Labranche and 3 other Louisianians
At Office— Despatches from A. Gallatin— Fisheries— With Forrest and then Calhoun to J. Law’s funeral— Columbian Institute missed— Frye here at Eve— Walk with him. Chess.

6. VI:30. Waste of time— Heard Little— 2. Corinthians 5.10. Visit to La Branche &c— Gone— Met G. Hay and Scott. Notice of funeral Sermon— P.M. Luke 7:16. Johnson Hellen left us— Eve writing to my wife.

7. V:15. At the Office— Dr Ayres with Letters from Wirt and Homans— Letters from R. Rush— Bathurst ad interim— G. Hay— Letter from G. M. Dallas. Call at Metropolis Bank— Evening attempt to go to Bomford’s to visit Erving. E. Mix at the Office.

8. VI:15— Berryman, Judge Cranch, and Bailey here— Clark’s pamphlet— Force.— Bailey and Newman—Cousin of the Baltimore Newman’s— Caldwell. Dr Eyres Slave-trade and Chase— Coll. Henderson—been to Quebec & Boston. Office— H. Johnson— Read to him the Convention with G.B. & Russia. Wrote to P. B. Porter—in part—and to G. M. Dallas at Eve—

9. VI:15. Maul here— Warren sick— Diary. Landon Carter at the Office. For Secy Legation S.A. Letter from A. Stevenson— Letter to P. B. Porter— Report on Accounts of J. Mitchell commenced— Evening walk. Chess.

10. VI— Rice here. Columbian College Loan— Call at King the Painter’s. Penrings— At the Office— Mitchell’s Accounts scarce touched— Evening at Dr Thorntons— T. T. Tucker. Petry. Danish Officer there— Crawford’s Letter about W. H. Harrison— Letter to L. C— A.
11. V: Letters to T. Jefferson and Jas. Madison— Mitchell’s Accounts at the Office. Mrs. Adams. T. B. Johnson and Mary Hellen came home.

12. V:30. L. Rice here— Genl. Scott— Letter to R. Walsh jr.— Connell here, and dined with us— Mitchell’s Accounts— Report— Letter from my father— Fortior Ito— Chess. T. B. J. and Mrs Smith dined out— Mr. and Mrs Frye here at Eve— Moses Young died.

13. VI:15. G. S. Bulfinch here— Heard Little. 1. Corinthians 15.26. Anthem. Dying Christian— Cards to Genl. Brown, Kirby and Dix— At M. Young’s funeral— Rode home with Dr. Thornton— G. Hay for Linnaeus Smith— F. C. Gray here this Eve.

14— V:15. Berryman here—and I. K. Hanson— J. M. Baker. W. Brown. B. O. Tayloe for G. Forrest— Anderson for Berryman and Reilly. Bailey for G. S. Bulfinch— Cathcart, Ridgley, Bestor, R. B. Lee. Hickey. At the Office— Berryman, Calhoun for Van den Burgh, H. Forrest for Watson, Maury— Wirt’s Letter— T. Law here at Eve— Chess. C. Cutts.

15. VI. G. S. Bulfinch here—disappointed— Hood—arry and hisn. G. Hay. Allison at the Office with Letters from J. Mason and P.U.S— Preparing to answer Deabbate— Letter to Jos. Hall at Eve— Mrs Meigs’s Papers

16. V:30. Letter to J. Brooks. At the Office— Deabbate’s Letters. J. M. Baker placed— Visit to Mr Brown of L— Calhoun at the Office— Mr and Mrs Frye here at Eve— Despatch from Rush— Fisheries— Thornton’s Greek Meeting—

17. VI. Letter from P.U.S. to return to-morrow or next day— Visits from Mr and Mrs Brown, and Mrs Wirt— Gouverneur’s— Bibby’s &c— Pleasonton and Warner at the Office— Deabbate’s papers. Evening walk. Chess.

18. VI:15. At the Office—finished the Letter to Deabbate— Evening wedding Ball at Mr Ramsay’s— Examination of Mrs Meigs’s papers— Chess— Stackelberg at the Office. Exequatur’s for Consuls at Philadelphia and New-Orleans.

19. VI: Johnson Hellen here— P.U.S. returned. Letter to Habersham. Letters from Vincennes— John & Charley. A. Gallatin. Drayton. Party at Mrs Brown’s—did not go. T. B. J. dined at Frye’s. Evening walk. Chess. F. L. Smith accepts.

20. VI:30— D. Brent here. Heard Little. Ephes. 4.5— At Brown’s Hotel. Jessup at Mrs Peyton’s. Call on Scott— Mrs & Miss Mason— P.M. heard Breckenridge— Romans 8.1— Evening at P.U.S—numerous company there. Hortensia’s musick.— Yard, Scott, Winder, G. Graham, Harrison, T. Ringgold and Ladies— Bailey and Newman here— sultry weather.

21. VI. Letter from J. M. Baker— Mrs Meigs’s Account. Stackelberg at the Office about Exequaturs received— Cowper, for Young’s Slaves sold in Jamaica to enquire into it— Letter from D— At P.U.S—gone out. Early dinner— Eve. Mathews at home— Crowd— Full house— George’s Sprain— Mrs Smith sick.

22. V:15. Pettus at the Office. Inquisitive at P.U.S. with despatches for A. Gallatin and R. Rush— R. Campbell to be consul at Genoa. To make minutes for the foreign part of the message— Deabbate’s claims— Danish Slave—to be left to the Court’s— Despatch to Forsyth— Florida Archives— Evening walk— Chess— Johnson Hellen to Rockville.
23. VI:15. C. Hay here with Linnaeus Smith— Office. Letter from C. Parker. Consul at Curacao— Expedition vs Porto-Rico. At P.U.S— Letters from Ramage to Biddle— Evening party. Ramsay’s— Mrs Minor &c.

24 VI:30. Mrs. A. and T. B. J. dined at Alexandria. At the Office, Canning, Quebec. Montreal. Boston— West-India intercourse— Act of Parliament— Act of Congress, and Proclamation— Duties— Ghent Commission. Art. 5— G. Canning’s Administration— Slave-trade— My concern— Evening walk— Chess— Letter from G.B. to U.S.A.

25. VI:30— At the Office. E. Coles of Illinois—Governor elect. Letter to Colvin— Note from P.U.S. Cabinet Meeting to-morrow, at Noon— Letter to John— Met and walk’d with T. B. J. met Johnston. Evening walk— Chess.

26— V:30. Cabinet Meeting at 12— Calhoun and Wirt— Letters from Spence, Cassin and Renshaw to Secy Navy— Homans came— Piracy. Question of Convoy discussed— Executive right— Morel & Early— Laborie here at Eve— Mrs. A. dined at Frye’s— Child sick.
27. VI: Rainy day. Heard Little. Gal: 6.14.15. Atonement— Communion. P.M. Service prevented by the weather. Letters from Prevost, Sartoris, and Burckle— E. Coles dined with us—

28. V:30. At the Office— Canning— West-India trade— Letter from Barbadoes— Same fees— Discriminating duties— Hollingsworth’s Letter— Export Bond, and duty 4 1/2 per Cent— Our own interest— Note— The Russian Convention— Ratification. Great Seal— 5th. Ghent Article— The Geographer— Can we agree to a line? The road. Evening Chess.

29. V:15. T. B. J. to Frye’s. Visit to Livingston with him. At P.U.S. Anduaga’s Notes— Escandell— Porto-Rico expedition— Tribunal— W. B. for an Act of Congress— The Proclamation. Canning’s Note— Hollingsworth’s Letter— Minutes for the Message— P.U.S. going to Loudoun—interruptions— Norwich Collector— Lanman— Burbeck— Channing’s Letter— Office. Letters to Harmes and Wichelhausen— H. Johnson, Livingston, and Newman here at Eve. Chess.
30. VI— Metropolis Bank—transfer to T. B. J. Milton Wells, here and at the Office— His secret— Parish for Canning— To alter his Note— Extract from his despatch— Walks— Chess.

31. VI. S. H. Smith, with Harris and Morel of Georgia— Harrison. Auditor. P.U.S. at the Office— Copy of Letter to R. Rush— 27. Augt. Hollingsworth’s Letters Woodley’s— Parish for Canning’s Note— Dined at Wirt’s— W. King about the boundary— Chess with Watkins— He took me home. Stackelberg’s note.
